documentation.text:
@dev Generates a pseudo-random index for minting an NFT.
 This ensures that each minted token gets a unique index without repetition.
 Mechanism:
 - Selects a random index from the range of unminted tokens.
 - Uses `availableTokenIndices` to track which positions are already taken.
 - Swaps the chosen position with the last available one to prevent reuse.
 @return uint256 The generated random index.

documentation.text:
@dev Mints a single token to the specified recipient in exchange for the required minting fee.
 Requirements:
 - The contract must not be paused.
 - Minting must be allowed (per `canMint`).
 - The `recipient` must not have the blocked role.
 - `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
 - `msg.value` must be at least `mintFee`.
 Effects:
 - Transfers the minted token to `recipient`.
 - Refunds any excess ETH sent above `mintFee` back to the caller.
 @param recipient The address to receive the minted token.
 @return success A boolean indicating whether the mint operation was successful.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Collection: Recipient cannot be the zero address"

arguments.value: Collection: Recipient cannot be the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Collection: Recipient cannot be the zero address"

documentation.text:
@dev Mints multiple tokens to the specified recipient in a single transaction,
      in exchange for the required batch minting fees.
 Requirements:
 - The contract must not be paused.
 - Minting must be allowed (per `canMint`).
 - The `recipient` must not have the blocked role.
 - `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
 - `quantity` must not exceed `MAX_BATCH`.
 - `msg.value` must be at least `mintFee * quantity`.
 Notes:
 - If the requested `quantity` exceeds the remaining supply, it is adjusted to the available amount.
 Effects:
 - Transfers the specified number of minted tokens (adjusted if necessary) to `recipient`.
 - Refunds any excess ETH sent above the total required fee back to the caller.
 @param recipient The address to receive the minted tokens.
 @param quantity The number of tokens to mint in this batch.
 @return success A boolean indicating whether the batch mint operation was successful.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Collection: Recipient cannot be the zero address"

arguments.value: Collection: Recipient cannot be the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Collection: Recipient cannot be the zero address"

documentation.text:
@dev Mints multiple tokens to the specified recipient in a single transaction,
      without requiring payment (free mint), subject to applicable constraints.
 Requirements:
 - The contract must not be paused.
 - Minting must be allowed (per `canMint`).
 - Caller must have the minter role (`isMinter`).
 - The `recipient` must not have the blocked role.
 - `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
 - `quantity` must not exceed `MAX_BATCH`.
 Notes:
 - If the requested `quantity` exceeds the remaining supply, it is adjusted to the available amount.
 Effects:
 - Transfers the specified number of minted tokens (adjusted if necessary) to `recipient`.
 @param recipient The address to receive the minted tokens.
 @param quantity The number of tokens to mint in this batch.
 @return success A boolean indicating whether the batch mint operation was successful.

NewMint(address,uint256).details: Emitted when a new NFT is minted. `account` is the address that received the minted NFT. `tokenId` is the unique identifier of the newly minted token.

claimERC20(address,uint256,address).details: Only callable by the contract owner.

params.to: The address to transfer tokens to.
params.value: The amount of tokens to be transferred.

claimERC721(address,uint256,address).details: Only callable by the contract owner.

params.to: The address to transfer the NFT to.
params.tokenId: The ID of the NFT to be transferred.

claimETH(address,uint256).details: Only callable by the contract owner.

params.to: The address to transfer ETH to.
params.value: The amount of ETH (in wei) to be transferred.

getNftContract().details: Returns the contract address of the current NFT instance.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

isPaused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

minterOf(uint256).details: Returns the address that minted a given token ID.

mintersOf(uint256[]).details: Returns the addresses that minted a list of token IDs.

returns._0: An array of addresses corresponding to each token's minter.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. - 'role' must not be 'BLOCKED_ROLE'

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

setPause(bool).details: If paused, all functions with `whenNotPaused` will be disabled.

params._paused: The new paused state to set.

updateNftContract(address).details: Updates the NFT contract address. Can only be called by an account with the Dev role. Requirements: - `nftAddress` cannot be the zero address. - `nftAddress` must be different from the current NFT contract address.

returns._0: bool Returns true if the update is successful.

claimERC20(address,uint256,address).notice: Withdraws ERC20 tokens from the contract to a specified address.

claimERC721(address,uint256,address).notice: Withdraws an ERC721 NFT from the contract to a specified address.

claimETH(address,uint256).notice: Withdraws ETH from the contract to a specified address.
